message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DB, cs.CR, cs.Distributed, cs.NI. 

The paper discusses a protocol-agnostic approach to improving the performance of primary-backup consensus protocols in blockchain databases. This topic falls under the category of distributed computing (cs.DC) and database systems (cs.DB). The paper also addresses the issue of malicious primaries affecting system throughput, which is a concern in the field of computer security (cs.CR). The proposed approach involves running several instances of the underlying BFT protocol in parallel, which relates to the sub-category of distributed systems (cs.Distributed). Finally, the paper discusses the achieved throughput of the proposed approach, which is a performance metric relevant to networked systems (cs.NI).
